casebody.data:
Rose against King.

After special demurrer ¿o a bill, the plaintiff may have leave to a» mend, on payment, of costs.

TO the bill in this case there was a special demurrer, which the Court inclined to consider as sufficient, and the plaintiff moved for leave to amend his bill in order to remove the objection, to which The Chancellor said there could be no objection, upon payment of, costs; and so it w.v> or» <4ered accordingly..
